Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Oncorhyncin II (Oncorhyncin-2, natural AMPs; fish, animals; histone-derived; Ala-rich; Lys-rich)

Literature Information.Literature: Chemical modification:  Possibly a 69-residue C-terminal fragment cleaved from histone H1, probably phosphorylated at two residues.Activity: Active against M. luteus (MIC ~1.0 uM), P. citreus (MIC 0.8 uM), E. coli (MIC ~1 uM), and L. anguillarum (MIC ~ 1 uM). It had an effect on lipid bilayer as well.Toxicity: It displayed poor hemo-lytic activity (0.7% hemolysis at 0.8 uM).Updated 3/2010; 7/2021; 11/2023 GW.
Literature Information.Author: Fernandes JM, Molle G, Kemp GD, Smith VJ. 2004
Literature Information.Title: Isolation and characterisation of oncorhyncin II, a histone H1-derived antimicrobial peptide from skin secretions of rainbow trout, Oncorhynchus mykiss.
